Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or sources to support the statement that the three winners of the $1.6 Powerball lottery have identified themselves on social media. It is unclear where this information is coming from.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the winners of the lottery have identified themselves on social media without providing any evidence or confirmation of this fact.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that as of 15 January 2015, the officially identified winners of the $1.6 billion Powerball lottery are John and Lisa Robinson of Mumford, Tennessee. This contradicts the claim that the winners have identified themselves on social media.
Understate: There is no evidence provided to understate or downplay the claim.
